Required Elements of Administrative Decisions
Administrative decisions must include the following elements:
identification of the issue(s) adjudicated
summary of the
evidence considered, and
laws and regulations applicable to the claim
a listing of findings that are favorable to the claimant under
38 CFR 3.104(c)
, if any, and
identification of the element(s) required to grant the claim that were not met.
Exception
:  PMCs are not required to list favorable findings in administrative decisions.  Favorable findings are addressed in PMC decision notices.
